intro: Luehea scabrifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved luehea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in wetlands or along riverbanks. Luehea scabrifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
